  • Constructor Details

    • ValueGroup

      @SafeVarargs public ValueGroup​(String[] keys, T... values)

    • ValueGroup

    • ValueGroup

      @SafeVarargs public ValueGroup​(Supplier<T> defaultValueSupplier, String[] keys, T... values)

      Constructs a new ValueGroup instance containing the specified keys and corresponding values and a default value supplier.

      1. Both arrays must be non-null.
      2. The contents of both arrays must be non-null.
      3. The key array and value array must be the same size.
      4. Neither array can be empty.
      5. The arrays stored within a ValueGroup are shallow copies.

      Default Supplier Details

      1. If the specified Supplier is null or default, a fallback Supplier is automatically created instead.
      2. The fallback Supplier will cause the default value to always be the first value in this ValueGroup.
      3. More specifically, the fallback Supplier is () -> getValueAt(0).
      Parameters:
      defaultValueSupplier - The Supplier that returns the default value for this ValueGroup instance.
      keys - The array of keys mapped to the specified values.
      values - The array of values mapped by the specified keys.

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()

      Returns the number of values stored within this ValueGroup object.

      Returns:
      The number of values stored within this ValueGroup object.

    • getValues

      public T[] getValues()

      Returns an array of all values stored within this ValueGroup object.

      1. The array returned by this method is a shallow copy.
        As a shallow copy, changes made to the array itself will have no impact on this ValueGroup object, but changes made to the actual contents will.
      2. A new array is constructed each time this method is called, which is a resource-intensive operation when called frequently.
        Therefore, caching the returned value is recommended in the vast majority of cases.
      3. The order of values will always be maintained in the array returned by this method.
      Returns:
      An array containing all values stored within this ValueGroup object, in order.
      See Also:
      Arrays.copyOf(Object[], int), getKeys()

    • getKeys

      public String[] getKeys()

      Returns an array of all keys stored within this ValueGroup object.

      1. The array returned by this method is a shallow copy.
        As a shallow copy, changes made to the array itself will have no impact on this ValueGroup object, but changes made to the actual contents will.
      2. A new array is constructed each time this method is called, which is a resource-intensive operation when called frequently.
        Therefore, caching the returned key is recommended in the vast majority of cases.
      3. The order of keys will always be maintained in the array returned by this method.
      Returns:
      An array containing all keys stored within this ValueGroup object, in order.
      See Also:
      Arrays.copyOf(Object[], int), getValues()

    • getDefaultValue

      public T getDefaultValue()

      Returns the default value for this ValueGroup object by calling the default value supplier for this ValueGroup instance.

      1. If the default value supplier assigned to this ValueGroup is null, then getValueAt(0) is returned instead.
      2. The value returned by the default value supplier is not cached, therefore, the default value supplier is executed every time getDefaultValue() is called.

      Note: The logic detailed above is located/handled in/by the constructor, not in/by this or any other method.

      Returns:
      The default value for this ValueGroup object.

    • getValueAt

      public T getValueAt​(int index)

      Returns the value at the specified index.

      1. If the specified index is a negative value, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
      2. If no value exists at the specified index, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the value being retrieved.
      Returns:
      The value located at the specified index.
      If the index is invalid, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • get

      public T get​(String key)

      Returns the value mapped to the specified key.

      1. If the specified key is null, the default value is returned.
      2. If the specified key is default, the default value is returned.
      3. If the specified key does not exist in this ValueGroup object, a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
      4. For all non-default keys, getValueFor(key) is identical to getValueAt(getIndexOf(key)).
      Parameters:
      key - The String to be used as the key.
      A null or default key will return the result of getDefaultValue().
      Returns:
      The value mapped to the specified key in this ValueGroup object.

    • getKeyAt

      public String getKeyAt​(int index)

      Returns the key at the specified index.

      1. If the specified index is a negative value, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
      2. If no key exists at the specified index, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the key being retrieved.
      Returns:
      The key located at the specified index.
      If the index is invalid, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • getIndexOf

      public int getIndexOf​(String key)

      Returns the index at which the specified key is located.

      1. If the specified key is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.
      2. If the specified key does not exist in this ValueGroup object, -1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      key - The String to be used as the key. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      The index at which the specified key is located, or -1 if the specified key does not exist in this ValueGroup object.

    • getValuePairAt

      public ValuePair<String,​T> getValuePairAt​(int index)

      Constructs a new ValuePair containing the key and value located at the specified index.

      Parameters:
      index - The index of the ValuePair being retrieved.
      Returns:
      The newly created ValuePair containing the key and value located at the specified index.
      See Also:
      getKeyAt(int), getValueAt(int), getValuePairs()

    • getValuePairs

      public ArrayList<ValuePair<String,​T>> getValuePairs()

      Constructs a new ArrayList and then populates it with all ValuePairs represented by this ValueGroup.

      Returns:
      The newly constructed ArrayList containing all ValuePairs represented by this ValueGroup.
      See Also:
      getValuePairAt(int)

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if this ValueGroup is valid. Details below.

      1. validateArrayNullity(boolean)
      2. validateArrayLength(boolean)
      3. validateDefaultValueSupplierNullity(boolean)
      4. validateValueArrayContents(boolean)
      5. validateKeyArrayContents(boolean)
      Specified by:
      isValid in interface SelfValidatable
      Parameters:
      throwException - True if a detailed Exception should be thrown if this SelfValidatable is invalid, false if it should follow through with a return value depicting the validity instead.
      Returns:
      True if none of the aforementioned methods indicate an invalid state, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.
      See Also:
      validateArrayNullity(boolean), validateArrayLength(boolean), validateDefaultValueSupplierNullity(boolean), validateValueArrayContents(boolean), validateKeyArrayContents(boolean)

    • validateArrayNullity

      private boolean validateArrayNullity​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if the values and keys arrays are non-null.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if an exception should be thrown if the state is invalid, false if the method should return instead.
      Returns:
      True if both values and keys arrays are non-null, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.

    • validateArrayLength

      private boolean validateArrayLength​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if the values and keys arrays are of the same length.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if an exception should be thrown if the state is invalid, false if the method should return instead.
      Returns:
      True if values and keys arrays are the same size, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.

    • validateDefaultValueSupplierNullity

      private boolean validateDefaultValueSupplierNullity​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if the default value supplier is null.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if an exception should be thrown if the state is invalid, false if the method should return instead.
      Returns:
      True if the default value supplier is non-null, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.

    • validateValueArrayContents

      private boolean validateValueArrayContents​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if there are any null elements in the values array.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if an exception should be thrown if the state is invalid, false if the method should return instead.
      Returns:
      True if all elements in the values array are non-null, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.

    • validateKeyArrayContents

      private boolean validateKeyArrayContents​(boolean throwException)

      Checks if there are any null elements in the keys array.

      Parameters:
      throwException - True if an exception should be thrown if the state is invalid, false if the method should return instead.
      Returns:
      True if all elements in the keys array are non-null, false otherwise.
      Note that if throwException is set to true, this method can only ever return true or throw an exception.

    • validateIndex

      public void validateIndex​(int index)

      Checks of the specified index is valid for this ValueGroup object.


      Note: Despite the similar name, this method is not called by the isValid(boolean) method.
      This is because this method is checking if an index is valid, whereas isValid(boolean) checks if the ValueGroup object itself is valid.


      Parameters:
      index - The index being validated.

    • newValueChangeGroup

      public static <T> ValueGroup<T> newValueChangeGroup​(T oldValue, T newValue)

      Constructs a new ValueGroup object containing the specified values.

      1. The keys assigned to the specified values are old and new, respectively.
      2. A default value is not provided.
      3. The ValueGroup created by this factory method is designed to be used with keys to improve readability when used.

        All of the following examples are valid, but readability is obviously improved when using keys.
        1. get("old") - Correct
        2. get("new") - Correct
        3. getValueAt(0) - Incorrect
        4. getValueAt(1) - Incorrect
        5. getDefaultValue() - Incorrect
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of values to be stored in the newly constructed ValueGroup.
      Parameters:
      oldValue - The value to be stored as the old value.
      newValue - The value to be stored as the new value.
      Returns:
      The newly constructed ValueGroup containing the specified values.
